message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses the use of local surrogate models to generate explanations for black-box classifiers, which is a common topic in the field of machine learning interpretability. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the impact of defining the right locality on the accuracy of the generated explanations, which relates to the field of data science and statistics, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a likely sub-category as well. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach on UCI datasets, which involves image classification, suggesting that cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) could also be a relevant sub-category.
